Articles.Content:
> 
> Standing by for today's riddle...

I think they will stop with the riddles as SQUAD has already announced the release date.

Me too...

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I think they will stop with the riddles as SQUAD has already announced the release date.

Oh, I hope not. I've been having such fun with them.

Happy landings!

> 
> I think they will stop with the riddles as SQUAD has already announced the release date.

Nah, it's fun to do them.

NEW RIDDLE!

[https://twitter.com/KerbalSpaceP/status/590523530451755008](https://twitter.com/KerbalSpaceP/status/590523530451755008)

![CDH10j3UUAAQ7MC.png:large](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDH10j3UUAAQ7MC.png:large)

It is of course [Vostok 6](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vostok_6). Where Valentina Tereshkova was the first Woman to orbit the Earth.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-21T14:36:12Z" title="04/21/2015 02:36  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 21, 2015</time> by Taki117**
![CDH10j3UUAAQ7MC.png:large](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CDH10j3UUAAQ7MC.png:large)
Damn you guys are quick ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

This one's fairly obvious if it's 7.

EDIT: nvm I thought ? was 7.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-21T14:42:03Z" title="04/21/2015 02:42  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 21, 2015</time> by Yukon0009**

Yep, called it, Vostok 6!

No idea if that's what the launcher looked like though.

Yup, I was expecting this.

 The **Ariane 6** is estimated to cost 75 million. Valentina launched on **Vostok 6**. 

Possibly more links...

Actually, maybe not, that craft looks more like one of the modern launchers that I've seen pics of while the Vostok 6 launcher looks like this:

Edit: Eh, just google Vostok 6.

But yeah, Ariane 6 and Vostok 6, I knew they wouldn't pass up that opportunity. for Val.

Ariane 5?

E: Oh, it's actually 6. @Slashy

> 
> Yep, called it, Vostok 6!
> No idea if that's what the launcher looked like though.

Nah. The image is of Ariane 6. 

The dimensions aren't quite correct according to the wikipedia article, though.

Best,

-Slashy

As for more links, maybe craft that the ariane 6 has launched?

Oh wait, it hasn't even been launched yet IRL, nvm.

> 
> Actually, maybe not, that craft looks more like one of the modern launchers that I've seen pics of while the Vostok 6 launcher looks like this:
> Edit: Eh, just google Vostok 6.
> 
> But yeah, Ariane 6 and Vostok 6, I knew they wouldn't pass up that opportunity. for Val.

I think the Craft is meant to get the numbers right more than anything. vostok 6 was just over 500t at launch, despite being launched on a soyuz rocket. It was also the first mission to carry a Woman (Valentina Tereshkova (Valentine Kerman)) into space. And, by virtue of being a soyuz Rocket it was 3 stages.

> 
> Nah. The image is of Ariane 6. 
> The dimensions aren't quite correct according to the wikipedia article, though.
> 
> Best,
> 
> -Slashy

Wikipedia is wrong ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

I like that there are two games going on here: (1) solve the puzzles knowing the numerical answer in advance, (2) guess what riddle Kasper will pick for the next number. With (2) there's always something to play in the Hype Train lounge car even if (1) is sorted.

Greetings,

So...was the Vostok 6 the first rocket ever to launch a gal in space? Guess I will add that to a contract LOL since we got fem kerbalnaut space engineers now...I like the idea myself...I just hope the megapack will make them look cute ! Now just to find room for them...

Cmdr Zeta
Any bets on Kasper doing the Saturn V tomorrow? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

And another riddle solved moves us ever closer to launch. We are currently at

6

and counting...

Happy landings!

> 
> Wikipedia is wrong ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

Ahh! That explains it. I could've spent hours looking for that connection ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Thanks,

-Slashy
ariane 6- it was way too easy with the mass and dimensions and pic kasper you probably should have gave us less details

It's hard to understand the picture of the rocket (too small) but it looks like they went with the abandonned all solid version of ariane 6 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (on the current a62 (1 cryogenic core stage and 2 SRBs, (which should be 500tons) the core stage is supposed to be slightly larger than the SRBs ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-21T15:31:29Z" title="04/21/2015 03:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 21, 2015</time> by sgt\_flyer**

> 
> It's hard to understand the picture of the rocket (too small) but it looks like they went with the abandonned all solid version of ariane 6 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (on the current a62 (1 cryogenic core stage and 2 SRBs, (which should be 500tons) the core stage is supposed to be slightly larger than the SRBs ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

It doesn't really matter which version of the Ariane 6 as long as people get it right that it's an Ariane 6.

Hey Kasper, idea if you're reading this, how about for the final one, do a collage of spaceflight firsts?

> 
> It doesn't really matter which version of the Ariane 6 as long as people get it right that it's an Ariane 6.
> Hey Kasper, idea if you're reading this, how about for the final one, do a collage of spaceflight firsts?
